author: Odeinoichus
title: Informative and Fun
review:
Standing Small is a bonus title which is included with The LEGO Book in a slipcover, the two books together make up a fount of knowledge that fans of LEGO may not have already been aware of, this title involves all information concerning the LEGO Mini-Figure, from the early days to the present. It includes photos of just about every different type of Mini-Figure there is, from the time of printing. I can't be sure if anything is missing from this book in that regard, after all there are quite a number of Mini-Figures... I suppose the only thing that could possibly be added to this might have been all of the animals which some consider extensions of the Mini-Figures.

 

As far as reading material goes I think it's worth the price of admission for both titles. And it allows you to see some cool fan-made Mini-Figures as well selected to be showcased in the last few pages of the book. As a reference guide I'd say this title is pretty good actually, and as a conversation piece it gives you a lot to talk about with your fellow LEGO enthusiasts. If you're looking for some good reading material concerning the LEGO Mini-Figure then this book is definitely for you.

author: TooMuchLEGO
title: Great Book
review:
This book as another user mentioned is packaged in with the LEGO Book. I am going to say this- I love this book. It showcases the many amazing minifigures LEGO has made, from the original Police Minifigure to Solid Gold 3P0. It also showcases some neat custom minifigures- like a US dress marine to a PacMan fan to the author of the book (Nevin Martell). 
There were a few errors in this book, however- for instance, it shows a castle knight as being made in 19923, and it listed a flesh Dumbledore as being made in 2001. However the faults can be forgiven.
Overall this book is great, it gives a lot of information, and it's really just super cool. I recommend getting it!
